p.em: When cartilage is damaged during the development of osteoarthritis, what noninvasive treatment is available?

multiple_choice.choice: Increase blood flow to the site of the injury
Reduce use of the joint until it heals

response.feedback: Incorrect. There are no blood vessels in cartilage, so that won't help.
Incorrect. When you eat those proteins, your digestive system completely breaks them down. Clinical studies have shown no benefit to ingesting supplements or increased protein.

Correct. Unfortunately, without invasive treatment (such as surgery) it just takes time for cells to secrete more extracellular matrix. It is important that the affected person not injure the articulation further during healing.
Incorrect. This is a possibility for the future, but is not possible right now.

part.hint: How does homeostasis progress in normal tissue? A correct response to injury in the body will attempt to move the body toward homeostasis.
